intro: Phanera riedelii, commonly known as the Riedel's phanera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Phanera riedelii is often found growing along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth.
